page.title: 07Upton Church(nr.Gainsborough
page.content: When the church was first built it was probably long and narrow,and wold have been without an aisle. In the thirteenth century the nave was rebuilt,a north aisle was added and the chancel was extended towards the east. One interesting feature remains in the eastern arm rest of the sedile(seat for the priest).Two windows were inserted in the eastern end but the small pointed oval light windows above them are certainly Victorian. In 1602 it was reported that the body of the church and the chancel was in need of repair but there is no evidence of any structural work having been carried out in the seventeeth century.In fact in 1776 the tower fell down and a new one,with a circular west window was not biult until 1840.
